On Thu, Oct 6, 2016 at 12:50 PM, ragnese <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I see. Is anyone willing to waste their time explaining why this choice
> was made? It seems to go against the principal of least astonishment. It
> would be less surprising if the compiler just "unrolled" the cases and
> compiled them as though each one was written independently. Is there some
> optimization or special feature one can take advantage of with the current
> spec being the way it is?
